transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Hey, uh, can I help you out in here?

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Oh, I'm all set, thanks.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Gotcha. Good. I'd go with the rows. That's a good idea.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Today is diversity day and someone's going to come in and talk to us about diversity. It's something that I've been pushing, that I've been wanting to push, for a long time and Corporate mandated it. And I never actually talked to Corporate about it. They kind of beat me to the punch, the bastards. But I was going to. And I think it's very important that we have this. I'm very, very excited.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: That's the thing. It's very sturdy paper and on the back it says, "100% post-consumer content." What? Hello? Uh-huh. Wait. What? I'm sorry, Mr. Decker. I think I'm losing you. [Shedder whirring] Hello? Hello? Yeah. Hold on one second. I don't know. Hold on one second.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: Do you really have to do that right now?

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: Yes I do. I should have done it weeks ago actually.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: Mr. Decker, I'm sorry about that. What were you... Can you hold on one second? Yeah, just one second. Thanks. [Power off, silence] Hello? That's it. Perfect. So what I was saying... [Dialing tone] Hello? Thanks, Dwight.

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: Retaliation. Tit for tit.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: That is not the expression.

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: Well, it should be.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: This is my biggest sale of the year. They love me over there for some reason. I'm not really sure why but I make one call over there every year, just to renew their account, and that one call ends up being 25% of my commission for the whole year, so I buy a mini bottle of champagne, celebrate a little. And this year I'm pushing recycled paper on them for one percent more. I know. I'm getting cocky. Right?

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: Solitaire?

transcript.name: Pam
transcript.line: Yeah, Freecell.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: Six on seven.

transcript.name: Pam
transcript.line: I know. I saw that.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: So then, why didn't you do it?

transcript.name: Pam
transcript.line: I'm saving that 'cause I like it when the cards go T-ts-ts-tch-tch-tch.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: Who doesn't love that?

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Hey, Oscar! How are you doing, man?

transcript.name: Oscar
transcript.line: All right.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Did you have a good weekend going there?

transcript.name: Oscar
transcript.line: It was fine.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Oh yeah, I bet it was fun. [to Mr. Brown] Oh, hey! This is Oscar---

transcript.name: Oscar
transcript.line: Martinez.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Right. See? I don't even know, first-name basis!

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Great. We're all set.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Oh hey, well, diversity, everybody, let's do it. Oscar works in... here. Jim, could you wrap it up, please?

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: Yeah, uh, Mr. Decker, please.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: It's diversity day, Jim. I wish every day was diversity day.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: You know what? I'm actually going to have to call you back. Thank you. Sorry about that.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Thank you. Thank you. Thank you. Great.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Come on people, let's get 'em in. Get in the cards! Get in the cards!

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Thank you. Thank you very much. OK. Thanks for filling these out and I promise this'll be quick. At Diversity Today, our philosophy is about honesty and positive expectations. We believe that 99% of the problems in the workplace arise simply out of ignorance.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: You know what? This is a color-free-zone here. Stanley, I don't look at you as another race.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Uh, see this is what I'm talking about. We don't have to pretend we're color-blind.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Exactly, were not...

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: That's fighting ignorance with more ignorance.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: With tolerance.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: No. With more ignorance.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Ignorance.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Right. Exactly. Uh, instead, we need to celebrate our diversity.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Let's celebrate.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Right. OK.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Celebrate good times. Come on! Let's celebrate diversity. Right?

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Yes, exactly. Now here's what we're going to do. I've noticed that...

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: You know what? Here's what we're going to do. Why don't we go around and everybody... everybody say a race that you are attracted to sexually. I will go last. Go.

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: I have two. White and Indian.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Actually, I'd prefer not to start that way. Michael, I would love to have your permission to run this session. Can I have your permission?

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Yes.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Thank you very much. And it would also help me if you were seated.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: OK.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Thank you. OK. Now, at the start of the session, I had you all write down an incident that you found offensive in the workplace. Now, what I'm going to do is choose one and we're going to act it out.

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: A few of the ground rules?

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Hey, hey why don't you run it by me and I'll run it by him.

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: OK, can we steer away from gay people?

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Um...

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: I'm sorry. It's an orientation. It's not a race. Plus a lot of other races are intolerant of gays, so...paradox.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Well, we only have an hour.

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: I figured it would save time.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: OK. Why don't we just defer to Mr...

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Mr. Brown.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Ah. Oh, right! OK. First test. I will not call you that.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Well, it's my name. It's not a test. OK? Um, so looking through the cards, I've noticed that many of you wrote down the same incident, which is ironic, because it's the exact incident I was brought in here to respond to. Now, how many of you are familiar with the Chris Rock routine? Very good. OK.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: How come Chris Rock can do a routine and everybody finds it hilarious and ground-breaking and then I go and do the exact same routine, same comedic timing, and people file a complaint to Corporate? Is it because I'm white and Chris is black?

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: So we're going to reenact this with a more positive outcome.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: I will play the Chris Rock guy. I would like to see someone else pull this off.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Well, let's have someone who wasn't involved in the reenactment.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: OK, I will play guy listening.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Great. Guy listening. Ok, anyone else remember?

transcript.name: Kevin
transcript.line: I remember.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Great. You're the Chris Rock guy and you're guy listening.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: OK.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Kevin is a great guy. He's a great accountant. He is not much of an entertainer.

transcript.name: Kevin
transcript.line: Basically, there are two types of black people and black people are actually more racist because they hate the other type of black people. Every time the one type wants to have a good time, then the other type comes in and makes a real mess.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: OK. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. He's ruin... He's butchering it. Could you just let me... [As Chris Rock] Every time... Every time black people want to have a good time, some ignant ass... [Bleep] I take care of my kid!

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Wait a second.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: [Bleep] They always want credit for something they supPOSED to do!

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Stop it!

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: [As Chris Rock] What you want a cookie?

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Now, this is a simple acronym. HERO. Uh, at Diversity Today, we believe it is very easy to be a HERO. All you need are honesty, empathy, respect and open-mindedness.

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: Excuse me, I'm sorry, but that's not all it takes to be a hero.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Oh, great. Well, what is a hero to you?

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: A hero kills people, people that wish him harm.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: OK.

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: A hero is part-human and part-supernatural. A hero is born out of a childhood trauma, or out of a disaster that must be avenged.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Ok, you're thinking of a superhero.

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: We all have a hero in our heart.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Now, I need you to take these forms. This kind of expresses the joint experience we had today. And I need you to look 'em over and sign them as kind of a group pledge.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: [Clears throat] I don't think I can sign this.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: I can't leave until you do.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Well, OK, it says here that I learned something and I knew all this stuff already, so... I know, I could sign something that says that I taught something, or that I helped you teach something, so... Pam! Where is she? Pam, could we change something on this?

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Michael, can I talk to you candidly?

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Sure.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: We both know that I'm here because of the comments you made.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Here's the thing. This office, I think this is very advanced in terms of... racial awareness and it's probably more advanced than you're used to. That's probably throwing you off a little bit.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Um, it's not throwing me. I need your signature.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: OK, well I know. You told me that several times.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Yes, but you're not listening to me. Yours is the only signature I need.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: OK.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Those are my instructions from the Corporate offices to put you through this seminar for the comments that you made. The reason I made copies for everyone was so you wouldn't be embarrassed.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Well, here I am thinking that you actually cared about diversity training. And you don't.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: Don't worry about dating.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: I won't.

transcript.name: Mr. Brown
transcript.line: OK. Thank you.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Yeah, yeah.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: "I regret my actions. I regret offending my coworkers. I pledge to bring my best spirit of honesty, empathy, respect and open-mindedness..." Open-mindedness, is that even a word? "...into the workplace. In this way, I can truly be a hero. Signed, Daffy Duck." [Laughing] He's going to lose it when he reads that.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: Yeah, hi. Is Mr. Decker around? Oh, well, could you just have him call me after lunch? Thank you.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: "I pledge to always keep an open mind and an open heart." I do believe... in that part of the pledge I that just read. But a pledge? Come on. I mean who are we, the Girl Scouts? No. Look... the guy, "Mr. Brown," he got us halfway there. He got us talking. Well, no. I got us talking. He got us nothing. He insulted us and he abandoned us. You call that diversity training? I don't. Were there any connections between any of us? Did anyone look each other in the eye? Was there any emotion going on? No. Where was the heart? I didn't see any heart. Where was my Oprah moment? OK, get as much done as you can before lunch because, afterward, I'm going to have you all in tears.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: All right? Everybody pretty? Come on. Here we go. It's time. Let's do some good.

transcript.name: Toby
transcript.line: Hey, we're not all going to sit in a circle Indian style are we? [Laughing]

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Get out.

transcript.name: Toby
transcript.line: I'm sorry.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: No, this is not a joke. OK? That was offensive and lame. So double offensive. This is an environment of welcoming and you should just get the hell out of here. OK, let's go. Let's do it. Come on. Let's have some fun, everybody. Here we go. Take a seat. Cop a squat. And um... thanks for coming in. Um... Diversity... is the cornerstone of progress as I've always said. But don't take my word for it. Let's take a look at the tape.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: [on the tape] Hi. I'm Michael Scott. I'm in charge of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products here in Scranton, Pennsylvania but I'm also the founder of Diversity Tomorrow, because today is almost over. Abraham Lincoln once said that, "If you're a racist, I will attack you with the North." And those are the principles that I carry with me in the workplace.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: OK. Questions? Comments? Anybody? Jim?

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Yes. I only had an hour to put it together but I'm going to add on to it later on.

transcript.name: Kevin
transcript.line: It was kind of hard to hear.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Uh, yes. That probably had something to do with the camera work. Anybody else? Um...

transcript.name: Kelly
transcript.line: I have a customer meeting.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Yeah, well, if you leave we'll only have two left. Yes. Enjoy. Absolutely. Namaste. Ok, well since I am leading this, let's get down to business and why don't I just kind of introduce myself, OK? Um. I am Michael and I am part English, Irish, German and Scottish. Sort of a virtual United Nations. But what some of you might not know is that I am also part Native American Indian.

transcript.name: Oscar
transcript.line: What part Native American?

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Two fifteenths.

transcript.name: Oscar
transcript.line: Two fifteenths, that fraction doesn't make any sense.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Well, you know what, it's kind of hard for me to talk about it. Their suffering. So who else? Let's get this popping. Come on. Who's going? Who's going? Let's go here. Oscar, right here. You're on.

transcript.name: Oscar
transcript.line: OK, Michael, um... Both my parents were born in Mexico.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Oh, yeah...

transcript.name: Oscar
transcript.line: And, uh, they moved to the United Sates a year before I was born. So I grew up in the United States.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Wow.

transcript.name: Oscar
transcript.line: My parents were Mexican.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Wow. That is... That is a great story. That's the American Dream right there, right?

transcript.name: Oscar
transcript.line: Thank... Yeah...

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Um, let me ask you, is there a term besides Mexican that you prefer? Something less offensive?

transcript.name: Oscar
transcript.line: Mexican isn't offensive.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Well, it has certain connotations.

transcript.name: Oscar
transcript.line: Like what?

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Like... I don't... I don't know.

transcript.name: Oscar
transcript.line: What connotations, Michael? You meant something.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: No. Now, remember that honesty...

transcript.name: Oscar
transcript.line: I'm just curious.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: ...empathy, respect... [Phone ringing] Jim! Jim!

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: Hello? Hello?

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: I have something here. I want you to take a card. Put it on your fore... Don't look at the card. I want you to take the card and put it on your forehead and... Take a card, take a card, any card. Um... And I want you to treat other people like the race that is on their forehead. OK? So everybody has a different race. Nobody knows what their race is, so... I want you to really go for it, cause this is real. You know, this isn't just an exercise. This is real life. And... I have a dream that you will really let the sparks fly. Get 'er done.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Why? Because Martin Luther King is a hero of mine. There's this great Chris Rock bit about how streets named after Martin Luther King tend to be more violent. I'm not going to do it but it's...

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Oh this is a good one.

transcript.name: Pam
transcript.line: Um, hi. How are you?

transcript.name: Stanley
transcript.line: Fine. How are you?

transcript.name: Pam
transcript.line: Great.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Push it.

transcript.name: Stanley
transcript.line: I admire your culture's success in America.

transcript.name: Pam
transcript.line: Thank you.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Good. Bom bom bom-bom bom. Come on Olympics of Suffering right here. Slavery versus the Holocaust. Come on.

transcript.name: Stanley
transcript.line: Who am I supposed to be?

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: No, that was inadvertent. We didn't actually plan that.

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: Lots of cultures eat rice, doesn't help me.

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: Um... Shalom. I'd like to apply for a loan.

transcript.name: Pam
transcript.line: That's nice, Dwight.

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: OK, do me. Something stereotypical so I can get it really quick.

transcript.name: Pam
transcript.line: OK, I like your food.

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: Outback steakhouse. [Australian accent] I'm Australian, mate!

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Pam, come on. "I like your food." Come on stir the pot. Stir the melting pot, Pam! Let's do it. Let's get ugly. Let's get real.

transcript.name: Pam
transcript.line: OK. If I have to do this, based on stereotypes that are totally untrue, that I do not agree with, you would maybe not be a very good driver.

transcript.name: Dwight
transcript.line: Oh, man, am I a woman?

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: You'll notice I didn't have anybody be an Arab. I thought that would be too explosive. No pun intended. But I just though. "Too soon for Arabs." Maybe next year. Um... You know, the ball's in their court.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: What are you watching?

transcript.name: Ryan
transcript.line: Chappelle's Show.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: Really?

transcript.name: Ryan
transcript.line: I downloaded it on her computer. I hope she doesn't mind. She just had a lot of extra space.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: No way. I think she likes this stuff.

transcript.name: Ryan
transcript.line: Great. She's cute, huh?

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: Yeah, you know, she's engaged, but...

transcript.name: Ryan
transcript.line: Oh, no, the girl in the... sketch.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: Oh, yeah. She's hot.

transcript.name: Kevin
transcript.line: Hey.

transcript.name: Angela
transcript.line: Hey.

transcript.name: Kevin
transcript.line: You wanna go to the beach?

transcript.name: Angela
transcript.line: Sure.

transcript.name: Kevin
transcript.line: You wanna get high?

transcript.name: Angela
transcript.line: No.

transcript.name: Kevin
transcript.line: I think you do, mon.

transcript.name: Angela
transcript.line: Stop...

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: OK. All right. No. It's good. You just need to push it. You need to go a little bit further. All right. OK.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: [Voice raised, Indian accent] Kelly, how are you?

transcript.name: Kelly
transcript.line: I just had the longest meeting.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Oh! Welcome to my convenience store. Would you like some googi googi? I have some very delicious googi, googi, only 99 cents plus tax. Try my googi, googi. [Lowering voice] Try my googi, googi. [High-pitched voice] Try my googi, googi. Try my... [slap!]

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: [trying not to cry] All right! All right! Yes! That was great, she gets it! Now she knows what it's like to be a minority.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: [on the phone] Mr. Decker, we didn't lose your sale today, did we? Excellent. OK. Let me just get your... what's that? No, we didn't close last time. I just need your... Oh. W-What code were you given? Oh, OK. That's actually another salesman here. I can redo it if you want to do that. Oh, he gave you a discount? No, I don't blame you.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: I just hated it when that guy was in here. Mr. Brown, if that was his real name. I mean, he had never met any of us before, and here he was telling us how to do our thing. I just wanted... I just wanted to do it our way. You know? On our own. Man I should have gotten some food.

transcript.name: Kevin
transcript.line: [Itialian accent]Maybe some spagh-etti.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: Okay, Kevin. You can take that off that thing, OK? That would really, really have shown him up, wouldn't it? If I'd brought in some burritos or some colored greens. Or some pad Thai. I love pad Thai.

transcript.name: Stanley
transcript.line: It's collard greens.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: What?

transcript.name: Stanley
transcript.line: It's collard greens.

transcript.name: Michael
transcript.line: That doesn't really make sense. Because you don't call them collared people, that's offensive. Hmmm... OK, well, it's after five. So... Thank you very much. Buena vista Oscar. Thank you. Good job. Oh, my man. Thank you Brazil. Nice.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: [Pam is asleep, resting her head on Jim's shoulder] Um... Hey.

transcript.name: Pam
transcript.line: [stirs] Mmmm.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: Hey.

transcript.name: Pam
transcript.line: Oh.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: We can go.

transcript.name: Pam
transcript.line: Sorry.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: That's fine.

transcript.name: Jim
transcript.line: Uh... Not a bad day.
